venue.name: Great Island Old Lyme Boat Ramp

item.description:
Hi Everyone,

TODAY
S WINDS AROUND 5 KT...INCREASING TO 10 TO 15 KT THIS
AFTERNOON. SEAS 1 FT OR LESS.


Last Year we all found this to be a favourite spot for a Barbie-q and paddle event(s)..
And last wekend it was good too...

This is an area that is good for both recreational and sea kayakers..
But recreational kayaks should have a blow whistle, float bags, a paddle leash, a paddle float , pump and...shouldnt go out in the deep too far. BUT RIDE THE INTERESTING WAVES HERE.
BUT REMEMBER you seen a recreational kayak sink before your eyes at Bolton lake..the body has never been recovered either, no PFD was worn either.
sea kayakers..well you know what its like out here..so i dont have to tell you anything,

DONT FALL IN, JELLY FISH ARE HUNGRY....

we will have a flotilla of stuff to bring out there..so if you fall in..good luck...
you are on your own.. we will grabb the food and bugg juice though..

I hope to barbie q on the island this time..but the deck area is the back up..bring a sun umbrella

DISCLAIMER:
IM OLD, HAVE NO ASSETTS, a big ass though, CANT HEAR OR SEE, AM WEAK AND THINK SHARKS ARE PETS..
SO YOU should BE ABLE TO DO SELF RESCUE.. YOU CAN PRACTICE THAT HERE ALSO in real ocean conditions..
im not going in the water to save you, i knowe there are giant blood suckers, monty pythons, piranahs, brain invading amebeas, and SHARKS.

Tides for Saybrook Point starting with July 12, 2008.
Day High Tide Height Sunrise Moon Time % Moon
/Low Time Feet Sunset Visible

Sa 12 Low 1:00 AM 0.8 5:27 AM Set 12:44 AM 66
12 High 6:59 AM 2.6 8:22 PM Rise 3:57 PM
12 Low 12:47 PM 1.0
12 High 7:23 PM 3.7

OK ALMOST THE OPPOSITE TIDE OF LAST SUNDAY...


I heard its going to SNOW today...????? and its going to be 23*F......
Im still going though....

Great Island area provides paddling in the secluded back channels, side rivers, and coves that parallel the lower Connecticut River near the mouth on the east side. You wind through 10-foot-tall marsh reeds and generally avoid the voluminous summer boating traffic. Whereas deeper-draft boats have to pay attention to the charts, kayaks can wander all over the place in the shallow waters here. Another advantage of the lower Connecticut is that three-quarters of the 1-mile?wide mouth averages a few feet in depth, which serves to keep motorboats to a minimum or forces them into the west channel, which exits through two stone breakwaters beyond Saybrook Point Lighthouse. The water just off the breakwaters is also very shallow? even small boats sometimes get grounded. Great Island offers good summer sea kayaking amid marsh grass, seaside goldenrod, glasswort, sea lavender, and water hemp.
This popular launch site, located less than 500 feet from the Great Island Wildlife Management Area, provides visitors with opportunities to explore tidal marshes and a barrier beach. It is important to note, however, that motorized vessels must remain a reasonable distance away from the Great Island Wildlife Management Area upon launching.

APX 95 (use whatever the gps indicates) Smith Neck Road
Old Lyme, Connecticut for GPS users.

from hartford: Apx 45 minutes.....

I Take rte 9 south past Essex to 95 North , rte 9 ends here, stay to the left fork

Take I-95 North to Exit 70. (Its right over the CT river bridge)

At the end of the exit ramp, turn right onto Route 156/Shore Road and continue 1.7 miles. to Smith neck rd

Caution: Some drove right past Smith Neck road last week...
After getting off the exit, Count 3 streets on right, ( look for Jonny cake Hill rd is on left) DIRECTLY across is the next right 3rd one = Smith Neck Road, (you cant see the name its occluded by the Yellow Left turn arrow Diamond Sign)
turn right onto Smith Neck Road, and proceed 0.7 miles (to its end at the boat ramp).

I will have the Blue Avalon with the kayak trailer and most likely i put the orange cones somewhere visible.
I dont expect this area to be filled..but dont know..our group Should doubble park with each other to save room for other boaters.

Active Rain or high wind (10+) , High seas (4+) canceles the event......i dont have a backup for this one at this time....

Kayaks Available:
Make sure you are familiar with their characteristics on maybe 1 to 4 or so foot waves..
The Brown Bathtub= Pungo 12' with floataion bags installed= kATHY ~G
The Blue Flipper Dipper= Riot Tourlite 15'=
The Yellow Bananna= Cobra Expidition SOT 18', = ALEX
The Red Eddyliner= Eddyline Wind Dancer 18'= BILL
The Red Greenland= NDK Greenlander Pro 18'= AL-r

$ 10 dollar doughnation per AL's Kayaks Used or bring extra food, or adult Bugg Juice for everyone..
